span.a: FOOD SERVICE MEALS DURING SCHOOL CLOSURE

em.span: *Update: food pick-up times - 4:00-5:30 p.m. through June 4, 2020

p.style: line-height: 18pt; font-family: tahoma; font-size: 10pt; padding: 0; margin: 0;
line-height: 18pt; font-family: tahoma; font-size: 10pt; padding: 0; margin: 0;

p.span: All CPS buildings are CLOSED for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year.
If you need to reach the Administration Office please call 989-386-9945 to leave a message; we will get back with you as quickly as possible.
Please see the attached updates regarding the coronavirus and upcoming events:

4/2/2020: With Governor Whitmer's Executive Order 2020-35, all K-12 school districts will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year for in-person instruction. Please continue to check our website, FaceBook, and emails from principals/teachers related to instruction. Schoolwork will begin the week of April 13th.
- If there are items in the school buildings that you did not pick up the week of April 13th, please reach out to your building principal to make arrangements.

- Seniors - assignments in core classes will continue through May as normal. For now, we will maintain May 31 for a planned graduation ceremony, but this could change. It is our intent to honor your achievements, even if the ceremony needs to take place during the summer.

- Incoming Kindergarteners - if you have a child heading to kindergarten next year, please email our staff at kindreg@clare.k12.mi.us and we will mail you a packet with information. We are currently working on digitizing these forms for your convenience. Kindergarten round-up will be rescheduled, likely during the summer.

div.span: Please continue to check back for updates.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: tahoma; line-height: 18px; color: darkslategray;

div.div: Parents of incoming Kindergarteners for the 2020-2021 school year:
Please complete the Kindergarten Registration Form and Transportation Form by clicking on each. Both documents can be filled out electronically and returned to: kindreg@clare.k12.mi.us

br.div: If you have any questions, please contact Clare Primary School. If you would like to mail your completed forms, please send to:

span.style: color: #464e54; line-height: 18pt; font-family: Tahoma; font-size: 10pt; text-decoration: underline;

div.p: School is out for the summer! Don’t forget to eat with Meet Up and Eat Up. Clare Primary School will be participating in Breakfast (8:55am-9:15am) and Lunch (11:25am-12:05pm) Monday-Thursday between June 15th-July 23rd. Everyone 18 years and younger eat free. Please visit www.michigan.gov/MeetUpEatUp or text Food to 877-877 for more information.

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

div.div: Each month while school is in session, we will recognize exemplary employees that make up our exceptional school system.
Announcing the March 2020 MVP(s) -- Most Valuable Pioneer(s): Chartwells Food Service Staff

div.p: Congratulations to Sarah Gariglio, Jane McJames, and the entire Chartwells Food Service staff, recognized as our Most Valuable Pioneers (MVP) for the month of March.

Over the past two weeks in response to the school closures, these folks have made and distributed over 10,000 meals to kids & families in our area. They do so with smiles, a tremendous work ethic, and big hearts.
Congratulations Sarah, Jane, and the entire Chartwells team. Thank you all for making Clare a great place to live and learn!
